briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Ranibizumab 0.5 vs Verteporfin PDT in Patients With Visual Impairment Due to Choroidal Neovascularization Secondary to Pathologic Myopia
officialTitle: A 12-month, Phase III, Randomized, Double-masked, Multicenter, Active-controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Two Individualized Regimens of 0.5mg Ranibizumab vs. Verteporfin PDT in Patients With Visual Impairment Due to Choroidal Neovascularization Secondary to Pathologic Myopia
conditions: Visual Impairment Due to Choroidal Neovascularization (CNV) Secondary to Pathologic Myopia (PM)
summary: This study was designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of two different dosing regimens of 0.5 mg ranibizumab given as intravitreal injection in comparison to verteporfin PDT in patients with visual impairment due to choroidal neovascularization secondary to pathologic myopia (PM)

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline BCVA to the Average Level of BCVA Over All Monthly Assessments From Month 1 to Month 3
